column1: Flucht­wa­gen-Fah­rer und Freund bei stür­mi­schem Wet­ter
column2: Getaway driver and friend in stormy weather

column1: und ein Stück Spiegelei baumelte von seinem buschigen Schnauzbart herunter
column2: and a piece of fried egg dangled from his bushy moustache

column1: und doch hat er es getan
column6:
doch = but still/all the same
hat from haben
getan = "done" = past participle of "tun" = "to do"

column1: doch seine Worte gingen in einem lang gezogenen, lauten Rülpser unter
column2: but his words were drowned in a long, loud belch
column6:
lang = long
lang gezogen = stretched out
laut = loud
Rülpser = belch

column1: Sonst fliegt sie doch immer draußen rum.
column2: Otherwise she's (Hedwig) always flying around outside.
The originator/creator of this was Dudley.
